titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn community newspaper collection ARC.258
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-12-15T13:30-0500

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn community newspaper collection, ARC.258, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains various 20th-century Brooklyn community newspapers, as well as a small number of magazines, published by public and private organizations and individuals throughout the period 1951 to 1990. Some papers contain information on issues affecting the entire borough, while others focus on specific neighborhoods. Included titles and date ranges of issues in the collection are listed below:

list.item: Brooklyn Journal of Arts & Urban Affairs, 1976
Brooklyn Paper (later The Brooklyn Paper of Carroll Gardens and Cobble Hill), 1983-1988
Brooklyn Progress, published by the Brooklyn Chamber of Commerce and the Downtown Brooklyn Development Association, 1974-1988
Community Advocate, published by the Southern Brooklyn Community Organization and the Ocean Parkway Community Development Corp., 1988
Park Slope Jewish Review, published by Congregation B'nai Jacob, 1988
